body: @MuhammadAsadJaved Hello, thank you for your interest in our work! We are unable to reproduce this error for video inference. Our video inference operates correctly, with or without `--view-img` ```bash $ python3 detect.py --source data/samples/drone1.mp4 --view Namespace(agnostic_nms=False, cfg='cfg/yolov3-spp.cfg', classes=None, conf_thres=0.3, device='', fourcc='mp4v', half=False, img_size=416, iou_thres=0.5, names='data/coco.names', output='output', save_txt=False, source='data/samples/drone1.mp4', view_img=True, weights='weights/yolov3-spp.weights') Using CPU video 1/1 (1/165) data/samples/drone1.mp4: 256x416 2 persons, 1 cars, 1 frisbees, Done. (0.615s) video 1/1 (2/165) data/samples/drone1.mp4: 256x416 2 persons, 1 cars, Done. (0.726s) video 1/1 (3/165) data/samples/drone1.mp4: 256x416 2 persons, 1 cars, Done. (0.567s) video 1/1 (4/165) data/samples/drone1.mp4: 256x416 2 persons, 1 cars, 1 frisbees, Done. (0.555s) video 1/1 (5/165) data/samples/drone1.mp4: 256x416 2 persons, 1 cars, 1 frisbees, Done. (0.564s) video 1/1 (6/165) data/samples/drone1.mp4: 256x416 2 persons, 1 cars, Done. (0.560s) ``` With regards to the webcam issue, yes this is an open issue with opencv presently and is already an open issue https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/issues/577
OK I'll try to fix it. thank you for your response.

@glenn-jocher 
Thanks for your work!

I use `my own dataset `to train `yolov3` in this repo with `darknet53.ccnv.74`

When I train about 150 epoch,there is not enough space on the computer disk,so the training break. After I move some fileï¼ŒI continue to train with `-- resume`

After training,I use `test.py` to test `mAP@0.5`

The following is the result

weights | mAP@0.5 | recall
-- | -- | --
best.pt | 0.607 | 0.766
lasst.pt | 0.645 | 0.777
backup270.pt | 0.644 | 0.777
backup230.pt | 0.643 | 0.774

The `mAP` and `recall` of `best.pt` is lower than other `backup**.pt`
What is reason?
Is the training normal?
@nyj-ocean if you check the code in train.py, you will notice mAP is calculated at 0.1 during training and at 0.001 on the last epoch. Thats why you see different results

@nyj-ocean best.pt currently saves at the lowest validation loss point, not the highest mAP point, so this could be the cause of the discrepancy. There is an ongoing debate about which to use actually, so perhaps this another point of evidence that we should switch back. The general argument in favor of saving at the lowest loss is that this should provide the best mAP across the different testing criteria, such as confidence levels, IOU thresholds, mAP@0.5 vs mAP@0.5:0.95 etc, whereas saving at the best mAP only applies to that specific metric.

@nyj-ocean also if you are running out of HDD space you can simply disable the backups here:

https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/53e3d55a1e002be343d49936e92c229e1d18fa58/train.py#L364-L367

@glenn-jocher  sir i am still unable to use video file with or without --view-img , it said predicted and saved but there is no view or saved output, i also install video codecs. There is no error message. Any expected missing files or libraries? or any other suggestions?  

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28862708/72487884-56031780-384a-11ea-90c7-acf0e67e9fd2.png)
@glenn-jocher  Can you tell me the OpnCV version you used? maybe it's opencv problem.

It's opencv problem. 
It worked with OpenCV 4.1.0 
Before I was trying with OpenCV  3.1.0
So please mention a recommended OpenCV version in the documentation.
@MuhammadAsadJaved great. ONNX model has no NMS, hence the multiple bounding boxes.
